finalDoc.PetPolicySummary: Atlas Air (charter) accepts service animals in the cabin at no charge; they must remain on the floor and cannot occupy a seat. Certain accommodations, including flights over 8 hours, require 48 hours’ advance notice. Atlas does not publish a general in-cabin program for non-service pets; non-service animals may be accepted as checked baggage or shipped as cargo at Atlas’s discretion. Live animals are transported as special cargo under IATA Live Animals Regulations and should be arranged via Atlas’s Special Loads Request portal. Health/vaccination certificates and entry/transit documents are required. No Atlas-published breed bans or brachycephalic-specific prohibitions were found; acceptance is case-by-case.
finalDoc.ImprovedPetPolicySummary:
Overview (Atlas Air – charter operations)

  • Service animals (in cabin): Accepted without charge. Must remain on the floor at the passenger’s seat and may not occupy a seat. Atlas may refuse carriage if necessary for safety/comfort/property protection. Certain accommodations (including flights of 8+ hours) require 48 hours’ advance notice. Source: Atlas General Conditions of Carriage (Dec 2024).
  • Non‑service pets (in cabin): Atlas does not publish a standard in‑cabin pet program. Non‑service animals are generally handled as checked baggage or cargo at Atlas’s discretion. Reservations for animal carriage as baggage must be made at least 72 hours before departure; animals must be properly crated and accompanied by required health/vaccination certificates and entry/transit documents. Charges apply and are typically coordinated with the charter operator. Source: Atlas GCC.
  • Live animals as cargo: Accepted case‑by‑case as Special Cargo under the IATA Live Animals Regulations (LAR). Use the Special Loads Request to arrange shipments. Container/kennel standards must meet IATA LAR. Coordinate specifics with Atlas Cargo. Source: Atlas Cargo – Special Cargo page; Cargo Tariff rules.
  • Documentation: Health and vaccination certificates, and any required entry/transit permits, are required. Destination authority rules apply. No microchip requirement is published by Atlas.
  • Restrictions: No Atlas‑published dangerous‑breed lists or brachycephalic‑specific bans were found; acceptance/conditions are case‑by‑case under IATA LAR and operational safety limits. Temperature/seasonal limits may apply operationally even if not published—confirm for your flight/shipment.
  • Emotional support animals (ESA): The GCC references emotional support/psychiatric service animals with 48‑hour notice for certain accommodations; however, U.S. DOT does not require acceptance of ESAs. Verify current acceptance with the charter operator and Atlas for your specific flight.

Official sources

  • General Conditions of Carriage – Passenger (Dec 2024)
  • Cargo Services: Special Cargo (Live Animals)
  • Atlas Policies
  • Special Loads Request Portal
finalDoc.inCompartmentDetails: Atlas does not publish a standard in-cabin program for non-service pets. Non-service animals are generally transported as checked baggage or cargo at Atlas’s discretion; reservations are required at least 72 hours before departure and animals must be crated with required documents. Service animals may travel in the cabin and must remain on the floor and not occupy a seat.
finalDoc.inCargoDetails: Live animals are accepted as special cargo under IATA Live Animals Regulations (case-by-case). Arrange via Atlas’s Special Loads Request portal; containers must meet IATA LAR standards. Coordinate specifics (routing, temperature limits, documentation) with Atlas Cargo and the chartering party.
finalDoc.carrierCompartmentDetails: No published in-cabin pet carrier program. Service animals travel without occupying a seat and must remain on the floor at the passenger’s seat.
finalDoc.carrierCargoDetails: Kennels/containers must comply with IATA Live Animals Regulations (size, ventilation, construction, food/water provisions). Booking and acceptance are case-by-case via Atlas Cargo/Special Loads Request; required paperwork includes health/vaccination certificates and any entry/transit permits.

Atlas may refuse carriage if necessary for safety/comfort/property protection. For certain accommodations (including flights over 8 hours), 48 hours’ advance notice is required. Refer to Atlas General Conditions of Carriage (Dec 2024).
